name: Introduction to Literary Analysis
subject: English
description: An introduction to the basic tools of literary analysis, including close reading, critical interpretation, and the use of literary terminology.
books: All The Light We Cannot See

name: American Literature I
subject: English
description: A survey of American literature from its beginnings to the Civil War, including works by writers such as Franklin, Poe, Emerson, Thoreau, Melville, and Dickinson.

name: Modern British Literature
subject: English
description: A study of selected British authors and works from the early twentieth century to the present, including writers such as Joyce, Woolf, Yeats, Eliot, Beckett, and Rushdie.

name: Shakespearean Comedies
subject: English
description: A study of Shakespeare's major comedies, including works such as A Midsummer Night's Dream, Twelfth Night, and The Merchant of Venice.

name: The Victorian Novel
subject: English
description: A study of the major Victorian novelists, including Dickens, Eliot, Hardy, and Thackeray, and their treatment of issues such as social class, gender, and imperialism.

name: Creative Writing: Fiction
subject: English
description: An introduction to the craft of fiction writing, including the elements of narrative, character, setting, dialogue, and point of view.

name: The Romantics
subject: English
description: A study of the major Romantic poets, including Wordsworth, Coleridge, Keats, and Shelley, and their treatment of themes such as nature, imagination, and the sublime.

name: The African-American Literary Tradition
subject: English
description: A survey of African-American literature from its beginnings to the present, including works by writers such as Douglass, Du Bois, Hurston, Baldwin, Morrison, and Coates.

name: Postcolonial Literature
subject: English
description: A study of literature written in English from former colonies of Britain and other European powers, including writers such as Achebe and Rushdie.
